title: How to Make a McDonald's Big Mac

steps.title: To make the sauce:
steps.content: To make the sauce: Mix all of the sauce ingredients together, and blend the mixture until smooth. Store it in the refrigerator for about an hour before use to allow flavors to blend.

steps.title: Prepare buns.
steps.content: Prepare buns. Take the crusts of the bun or in other words the bottom and top part where it's hard, and feed it to the birds, use it as a coaster, or just throw it away if you wish because it's not needed in this recipe.

steps.title: Prepare the beef patties.
steps.content: Prepare the beef patties. Flatten two patties to about 3-1/2 inches (85mm) in diameter, and about 1/4 inch (8mm) thick.

steps.title: Prepare the toppings.
steps.content: Prepare the toppings. Mince about a quarter of a small white onion and set aside. Shred or chop an iceberg lettuce leaf into thin strips.

steps.title: Cook the beef patties.
steps.content: Cook the beef patties. You can cook it however you wish and to your preference for doneness (rare to well done).

steps.title: Toast the 3 buns.
steps.content: Toast the 3 buns. While the patties are frying, gently toast the buns. Do this to the both sides of the regular bun bottom and toast the sesame bun as usual (the inner sides).

steps.title: Sauce the toasted buns.
steps.content: Sauce the toasted buns. Take the bottom of the regular bun and the bottom of the sesame bun and put 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of the sauce on them.

steps.title: Add lettuce, cheese, and pickles.
steps.content: Add lettuce, cheese, and pickles. Grab a big pinch of the sliced lettuce and plop it onto each sauced bun. On the bottom bun (the sesame), place a slice of cheese on top of the lettuce. On the regular bun, put the pickle slices on the lettuce.

steps.title: Load on the meaty goodness.
steps.content: Load on the meaty goodness. Stack each burger patty on top of the condiments (cheese and pickles) on each layer. Top both layers with minced onions.

steps.title: Stack it up.
steps.content: Stack it up. Pick up, carefully, the regular bun (with everything) and stack it on the bottom layer. Place the top of the sesame bun on top of the burger.
